pullrequest.title: Add //world/light to the sdf parsing stages and proposal as a sibling of //world/model

content.raw:
ok, but there's a lot of `//pose` elements that won't have any sibling frames that they could reference, so the `relative_to` attribute wouldn't do anything

For example (as discussed in pull request #16), inside a `//link`, the collision, visual, sensor and light elements all have pose elements, but none of them have implicit frames or sibling frames to reference with `//pose[@relative_to]` (hence the proposal in that PR for `//link/frame`). My approach so far in the code implementation is to only introduce the `relative_to` attribute to the model, link, joint, and frame elements that could possibly make use of it. Alternatively, we could allow all `//pose` elements to have a `relative_to` attribute, but it wouldn't be usable in many cases.
